page.title: 02INDUSTRY
page.content: At Craignair Quarry near Dalbeattie granite is excavated by blasting with gelignite to bring the granite down and if necessary secondary blasting to reduce the size of the pieces which are further reduced by pneumatic breakers.Crushed granite and granite chipings are produced by a crushing plant worked by 4 operaters.There is also a coating plant where granite chips are coated with bitumen to make Bitmac for road surfacing.Some of the products are used locally but mainly they go to Central Scotland to Builders Merchants. Granite has been quarried here since 1820 and at the present rate of extraction which is 125,000 tons per year it is estimated that the quarry will last for over 100 years.The 20 employees are mainly drivers of large trucks and excavators
